intro: Iberis maialis, commonly known as the Almondleaf Candytuft, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 cm, featuring basal rosettes of silver-green, lobed leaves. Its flowers are white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Iberis maialis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to rock gardens and coastal areas.
